natural problem: Add $81.76$ to $34.587$ and round your answer to the nearest tenth.
natural solution: First, we add the two numbers. \[ \begin{array}{@{}c@{\;}c@{}c@{}c@{}c@{}c@{}c@{}c} & & 8 & 1. & 7 & 6 & \\ +& & 3 & 4. & 5 & 8 & 7\\ \cline{1-7}& 1 & 1 & 6. & 3 & 4 & 7\\ \end{array} \]In order to round the result, $116.347$, to the nearest tenth, we must consider the hundredths place.
The hundredths digit is $4$, which is less than $5$, so the tenths place remains $3$. The answer after rounding is thus $\boxed{116.3}$.

a_0.formal problem:
theorem
fixes a b :: real
assumes h0 : "a = 81.76"
and h1 : "b = 34.587"
shows  "round (a + b) = 116.3"
a_0.formal solution:
(* ### Problem
 Add $81.76$ to $34.587$ and round your answer to the nearest tenth. The final Answer is 116.3
 ### Proof
 First, we add the two numbers. \[ \begin{array}{@{}c@{\;}c@{}c@{}c@{}c@{}c@{}c@{}c} & & 8 & 1. & 7 & 6 & \\ +& & 3 & 4. & 5 & 8 & 7\\ \cline{1-7}& 1 & 1 & 6. & 3 & 4 & 7\\ \end{array} \]In order to round the result, $116.347$, to the nearest tenth, we must consider the hundredths place.
 The hundredths digit is $4$, which is less than $5$, so the tenths place remains $3$. The answer after rounding is thus $\boxed{116.3}$.
 *)

theorem
fixes a b :: real
assumes h0 : "a = 81.76"
and h1 : "b = 34.587"
shows  "round (a + b) = 116.3"
 proof- 
  show ?thesis sledgehammer
a_0.informal problem: Round the sum of $81.76$ and $34.587$. The final answer is $116.3$.

a_5.formal problem:

fixes a b c :: real
assumes h0 : "a = 81.76"
and h1 : "b = 34.587"
and h2 : "c = a + b"
shows  "round(c*10)/10 = 116.3"
a_5.formal solution:
(* ### Problem
 Add $81.76$ to $34.587$ and round your answer to the nearest tenth. The final Answer is 116.3

 The hundredths digit is $4$, which is less than $5$, so the tenths place remains $3$. The answer after rounding is thus $\boxed{116.3}$.
 *)

fixes a b c :: real
assumes h0 : "a = 81.76"
and h1 : "b = 34.587"
and h2 : "c = a + b"
shows  "round(c*10)/10 = 116.3"
 proof-
